M00.desc: The M0 and M1 commands pause after the last movement and wait for the user to continue. M1 is a deprecated alias for M0.

S.shortDesc: Expire time, in seconds

s.shortDesc: An optional message to display on the LCD

M01.desc: The M0 and M1 commands pause after the last movement and wait for the user to continue. M1 is a deprecated alias for M0.

S.shortDesc: Expire time, in seconds

s.shortDesc: An optional message to display on the LCD

M3.desc: Wait for moves to complete, then set the spindle speed (clockwise) or laser power.

O.shortDesc: Spindle speed or laser power in PWM 0-255 value range

S.shortDesc: Spindle speed or laser power in the configured value range (see CUTTER_POWER_DISPLAY). (PWM 0-255 by default)

M4.desc: Wait for moves to complete, then set the spindle speed (counter-clockwise) or laser power.

O.shortDesc: Spindle speed or laser power in PWM 0-255 value range

S.shortDesc: Spindle speed or laser power in the configured value range (see CUTTER_POWER_UNIT). (PWM 0-255 by default)

M5.desc: Wait for moves to complete, then turn off the spindle / laser power and PWM.

M07.desc: This command pertains to a CNC machine with a liquid cooling system or a laser with air assist.

M08.desc: This command pertains to a CNC machine with a liquid cooling system or a laser with air assist.

M09.desc: This command pertains to a CNC machine with a liquid cooling system or a laser with air assist.

M10.desc: Immediately turn the cutter’s vacuum or laser’s blower motor on or off.

M11.desc: Immediately turn the cutter’s vacuum or laser’s blower motor on or off.

M16.desc: Do a case-sensitive comparison between the string argument and the configured MACHINE_NAME. If the machine name doesn’t match, halt the printer so that a reset is required. This safety feature is meant to prevent G-code sliced for a specific machine from being used on any other machine.

s.shortDesc: The string to compare to MACHINE_NAME.

M17.desc: This command can be used to enable one or more steppers (X,Y,Z,E).

E.shortDesc: E Enable

X.shortDesc: X Enable

Y.shortDesc: Y Enable

Z.shortDesc: Z Enable

M18.desc: This command can be used to set the stepper inactivity timeout (S) or to disable one or more steppers (X,Y,Z,E).

E.shortDesc: E Disable

S.shortDesc: Inactivity Timeout. If none specified, disable now.

X.shortDesc: X Disable

Y.shortDesc: Y Disable

Z.shortDesc: Z Disable

M84.desc: This command can be used to set the stepper inactivity timeout (S) or to disable one or more steppers (X,Y,Z,E).

E.shortDesc: E Disable

S.shortDesc: Inactivity Timeout. If none specified, disable now.

X.shortDesc: X Disable

Y.shortDesc: Y Disable

Z.shortDesc: Z Disable

M20.desc: List all printable files on the SD card back to the requesting serial port in compact DOS 8.3 format. Only files with .gcode, .gco, and .g extensions will be listed. Hidden files (beginning with .) will not be listed.

F.shortDesc: Only list BIN files. Used by host plugins to facilitate firmware upload.

L.shortDesc: Include the long filename in the listing.

T.shortDesc: Include the file timestamp in the listing.

M21.desc: Use this command to mount the last-selected SD card or thumb drive.

M22.desc: If Marlin gets confused about the state of the SD card, this command can be used to simulate an ejection of the SD card.

M23.desc: Select an SD file for printing or processing. Follow with M24 to run the selected file.

f.shortDesc: The filename of the file to open.

M24.desc: Start an SD print or resume the paused SD print. If PARK_HEAD_ON_PAUSE is enabled, unpark the nozzle.

S.shortDesc: Position in file to resume from (requires POWER_LOSS_RECOVERY)

T.shortDesc: Elapsed time since start of print (requires POWER_LOSS_RECOVERY)

M25.desc: Pause the SD print in progress. If PARK_HEAD_ON_PAUSE is enabled, park the nozzle.

M26.desc: Set the next read position in the open SD file.

S.shortDesc: Next file read position to set

M27.desc: With no parameter, report the current SD read position in the form “SD printing byte 123/12345.” If no file is open the response is “Not SD printing.”

C.shortDesc: Report the filename and long filename of the current file

S.shortDesc: Interval between auto-reports. S0 to disable (requires AUTO_REPORT_SD_STATUS)

M28.desc: This command starts a file write. All commands received by Marlin are written to the file and are not executed until M29 closes the file.

B.shortDesc: Set an optimized binary file transfer mode. (Requires BINARY_FILE_TRANSFER)

M29.desc: Stop writing to a file that was begun with M28 or M928. Logging is disabled.

M30.desc: Delete a file from the SD card.

f.shortDesc: The filename of the file to delete.

M31.desc: This command reports the time elapsed since the start of the current print job to the host. When printing from SD card, the print job timer starts as soon as SD printing starts.

M32.desc: The M32 command exists to allow G-code to load other G-code files and run them as sub-programs. This can be useful to change the start / end G-code for a batch of files without having to edit them all.

S.shortDesc: Starting file offset

M33.desc: Get the long name for a file based on the DOS 8.3 path.

p.shortDesc: DOS 8.3 path to a file or folder

M34.desc: Marlin now contains support for SDCard alphabetical file sorting in the LCD menus. This feature uses free SRAM to create a sorting index for up to the first 256 files in the current folder, and (if you have lots of SRAM) can optionally cache file listings for a more responsive UI. Buffering only occurs during file browsing. Otherwise the SRAM is freed.

F.shortDesc: Folder Sorting

S.shortDesc: Sorting on/off

M42.desc: For custom hardware not officially supported in Marlin, you can often just connect up an unused pin and use M42 to control it.

I.shortDesc: Ignore protection on pins that Marlin is using.

P.shortDesc: A digital pin number (even for analog pins) to write to. (LED_PIN if omitted)

S.shortDesc: The state to set. PWM pins may be set from 0-255.

T.shortDesc: Set the pin mode. Prior to Marlin 2.0.9.4 this is set with the M parameter.

M43.desc: When setting up or debugging a machine it’s useful to know how pins are assigned to functions by the firmware, and to be able to find pins for use with new functions. M43 provides these tools. M43 by itself reports all pin assignments. Use P to specify a single pin. Use I to report the values on pins that are protected. Use W to watch the specified pin, or all pins. Use the E option to monitor endstops. Use S option to test a BLTouch type servo probe. Use T option to toggle pins.

E.shortDesc: Watch endstops

S.shortDesc: Test BLTouch type servo probes. Use P to specify servo index (0-3). Defaults to 0 if P omitted

T.shortDesc: Toggle pins - see M43 T for options

M43 T.desc: The M43 T command toggles one or more pins.

I.shortDesc: Flag to ignore Marlin’s pin protection. Use with caution!!!!

L.shortDesc: End Pin number. If not given, will default to last pin defined for this board

R.shortDesc: Repeat pulses on each pin this number of times before continuing to next pin. If not given will default to 1.

S.shortDesc: Start Pin number. If not given, will default to 0

W.shortDesc: Wait time (in milliseconds) transitions. If not given will default to 500.

M48.desc: Probes come in many flavors and as such have varying levels of accuracy, reliability, and repeatability, depending on several factors. This command tests the probe for repeatability (precision) and produces a standard deviation based on two or more probes of the same XY position.

C.shortDesc: Probe with temperature compensation enabled (PTC_PROBE, PTC_BED, PTC_HOTEND)

E.shortDesc: Engage for each probe

S.shortDesc: Star/Schizoid probe. By default this will do 7 points. Override with L.

X.shortDesc: X Position

Y.shortDesc: Y Position

M73.desc: Set current print progress percentage and/or remaining time for display on the LCD.

s.shortDesc: A string to display in the LCD heading. (Requires DWIN_CREALITY_LCD_ENHANCED)

M80.desc: Turn on the high-voltage power supply. Requires a board that’s powered from USB or another 5V source.

S.shortDesc: Report Power Supply state

M81.desc: Turn off the high-voltage power supply. If the board is not powered from another source, this may also shut down the electronics.

M82.desc: This command is used to override G91 and put the E axis into absolute mode independent of the other axes.

M83.desc: This command is used to override G90 and put the E axis into relative mode independent of the other axes.

M85.desc: Use this command to set a maximum period of time for the machine to be inactive (with no moves). If the machine is idle for longer than the set period, the firmware will shut everything down and halt the machine.

S.shortDesc: Max inactive seconds

M92.desc: Use M92 to set the steps-per-unit for one or more axes. This setting affects how many steps will be done for each unit of movement.

E.shortDesc: E steps per unit

T.shortDesc: Target extruder (Requires DISTINCT_E_FACTORS)

X.shortDesc: X steps per unit

Y.shortDesc: Y steps per unit

Z.shortDesc: Z steps per unit

M100.desc: Use M100 for development purposes to observe how much memory (particularly stack) is being used by code. Proper AVR code should avoid use of new, malloc, etc., and instead use either pre-allocated static variables or stack.

C.shortDesc: Corrupt ‘n’ locations in the free memory pool and report the locations of the corruption. This is useful to check the correctness of the M100 D and M100 F commands

D.shortDesc: Dump the free memory block from __brkval to the stack pointer

F.shortDesc: Return the number of free bytes in the memory pool along with other vital statistics that define the memory pool

I.shortDesc: Initialize the free memory pool so it can be watched and print vital statistics that define the free memory pool

S.shortDesc: Set the Bed Distance Sensor state and trigger distance.

M104.desc: Set a new target hot end temperature and continue without waiting. The firmware will continue to try to reach and hold the temperature in the background.

B.shortDesc: AUTOTEMP: The max auto-temperature.

F.shortDesc: AUTOTEMP: Autotemp flag. Omit to disable autotemp.

S.shortDesc: Target temperature.AUTOTEMP: the min auto-temperature.

T.shortDesc: Hotend index. If omitted, the currently active hotend will be used.

M105.desc: Request a temperature report to be sent to the host as soon as possible.

R.shortDesc: Include the Redundant temperature sensor (if any)

T.shortDesc: Hotend index

M106.desc: Turn on one of the fans and set its speed. If no fan index is given, the print cooling fan is selected. The fan speed applies to the next block added to the planner, so it will not take effect until previous moves in the planner are done. Under manual control with an idle machine, M106 will change the fan speed immediately.

S.shortDesc: Speed, from 0 to 255. S255 provides 100% duty cycle; S128 produces 50%.

T.shortDesc: Secondary speed. Added in Marlin 1.1.7. (Requires EXTRA_FAN_SPEED)

M107.desc: Turn off one of the fans. If no fan index is given, the print cooling fan.

M108.desc: The M108 command requires EMERGENCY_PARSER for full effectiveness. (Otherwise a full queue blocks the parser.)

M109.desc: This command optionally sets a new target hot end temperature and waits for the target temperature to be reached before proceeding. If the temperature is set with S then M109 waits only when heating. If the temperature is set with R then M109 will also wait for the temperature to go down.

B.shortDesc: With AUTOTEMP, the max auto-temperature.

F.shortDesc: Autotemp flag. Omit to disable autotemp.

R.shortDesc: Target temperature (wait for cooling or heating).

S.shortDesc: Target temperature (wait only when heating). Also AUTOTEMP: The min auto-temperature.

T.shortDesc: Hotend index. If omitted, the currently active hotend will be used.

M110.desc: Hosts can use M110 to set the current line number in a print job. Each line number sent by a host must be one higher than the previous line number, or the firmware will ignore the line and send an error requesting a resend of the missing line. This is one technique Marlin uses to keep in sync with hosts.

M111.desc: Marlin has several debug bits that can be set, in combination, to help configure, troubleshoot, and debug the firmware. Add up the debug bits you need:

S.shortDesc: Debug flag bits

M112.desc: Used for emergency stopping, M112 shuts down the machine, turns off all the steppers and heaters, and if possible, turns off the power supply. A reset is required to return to operational mode.

M113.desc: During some lengthy processes, such as G29, Marlin may appear to the host to have “gone away.” The “host keepalive” feature will send messages to the host when Marlin is busy or waiting for user response so the host won’t try to reconnect.

S.shortDesc: Keepalive interval (0-60).

M114.desc: Get the “current position” of the active tool. Stepper values are included.

E.shortDesc: Report E stepper position (requires M114_DETAIL)

M115.desc: This command causes Marlin to output a string like this:

M117.desc: Set the status line message on the LCD.

M118.desc: Send a message to the connected host for display in the host console or to perform a host action.

A.shortDesc: Prepend //  to denote a comment or action command. Hosts like OctoPrint can interpret such commands to perform special actions. See your host’s documentation.

E.shortDesc: Prepend echo: to the message. Some hosts will display echo messages differently when preceded by echo:.

P.shortDesc: Send message to host serial port (1-9).

s.shortDesc: Message string. If omitted, a blank line will be sent.

M119.desc: Use this command to get the current state of all endstops, useful for setup and troubleshooting. Endstops are reported as either “open” or “TRIGGERED”.

M122.desc: Do a communication check for configured TMC drivers. Trinamic drivers that support this feature are TMC2130, TMC2160, TMC2208, TMC2209, TMC2660, TMC5130, and TMC5160.

E.shortDesc: Target E driver(s) only.

I.shortDesc: Flag to re-initialize stepper drivers with current settings.

P.shortDesc: Interval between continuous debug reports, in milliseconds.

S.shortDesc: Flag to enable/disable continuous debug reporting.

V.shortDesc: Report raw register data. Refer to the datasheet to decypher.

X.shortDesc: Target X driver(s) only.

Y.shortDesc: Target Y driver(s) only.

Z.shortDesc: Target Z driver(s) only.

M123.desc: If your machine has fans with tachometers this command will report their current speed readings in RPM. Marlin can also auto-report the fan speeds at regular intervals, as set by M123 S.

M125.desc: Save the current nozzle position and move to the configured park position.

P.shortDesc: Always show a prompt and await a response (With an LCD menu)

X.shortDesc: X position to park at (otherwise FILAMENT_CHANGE_X_POS)

Y.shortDesc: Y position to park at (otherwise FILAMENT_CHANGE_Y_POS)

Z.shortDesc: Z raise before park (otherwise FILAMENT_CHANGE_Z_ADD)

M126.desc: Open the valve for Baricuda paste extruder 1.

S.shortDesc: Valve pressure

M127.desc: Close the valve for Baricuda paste extruder 1.

M128.desc: Open the valve for Baricuda paste extruder 2.

S.shortDesc: Valve pressure

M129.desc: Close the valve for Baricuda paste extruder 2.

M140.desc: Set a new target temperature for the heated bed and continue without waiting. The firmware manages heating in the background.

S.shortDesc: Target temperature

M141.desc: Set a new target heated chamber temperature and continue without waiting. The firmware will continue to try to reach and hold the temperature in the background.

S.shortDesc: Target temperature.AUTOTEMP: the min auto-temperature.

M143.desc: Set a cooler target temperature and continue without waiting. The firmware manages cooling in the background. Any value greater than the COOLER_MAXTEMP (set in Configuratin_adv.h) will be set to the COOLER_MAXTEMP value. Use M193 if you want to wait for the cooler to reach the target temperature.

S.shortDesc: Target laser coolant temperature.

M145.desc: Set the preheating presets for materials in the LCD menu.

B.shortDesc: Bed temperature

F.shortDesc: Fan speed

S.shortDesc: Material index

M149.desc: Set temperature units to Celsius, Fahrenheit, or Kelvin. Celsius is the default.

F.shortDesc: Fahrenheit

M150.desc: If you have an RGB(W) light, either as part of a controller or installed separately, the M150 command can be used to set its color.

B.shortDesc: Blue component from 0 to 255

K.shortDesc: Keep all unspecified values unchanged (Requires NEOPIXEL_LED)

S.shortDesc: NeoPixel strip index (0 or 1) (Requires NEOPIXEL2_SEPARATE)

U.shortDesc: Green component from 0 to 255

W.shortDesc: White component from 0 to 255 (RGBW_LED or NEOPIXEL_LED only)

M154.desc: Some host software and serial controllers use M114 to get the current position, but polling with M114 is less than optimal, and in older versions of Marlin it would cause print stuttering. With M154 hosts can simply set an interval and Marlin will keep sending reports automatically. This method is preferred over polling with M114.

S.shortDesc: Interval in seconds between auto-reports. S0 to disable.

M155.desc: It can be useful for host software to track temperatures, display and graph them over time, but polling with M105 is less than optimal. With M155 hosts simply set an interval and Marlin will keep sending data automatically. This method is preferred over polling with M105.

S.shortDesc: Interval in seconds between auto-reports. S0 to disable.

M163.desc: Set a single mix factor (in proportion to the sum total of all mix factors). The mix must be committed to a virtual tool by M164 before it takes effect.

S.shortDesc: Component index
Tool index (active virtual tool if omitted)

M165.desc: Set the mix for the active virtual extruder all at once. Any factors left out are set to 0.0. This is based on a reference implementation by Pìa Taubert.

B.shortDesc: Mix factor 2

M166.desc: Use M166 to set a gradient that will be automatically updated as the Z position changes during a print. The gradient smoothly transitions from one virtual tool to another between the given starting and ending Z heights. Below the starting height the starting virtual tool fully applies, and above the ending height the ending virtual tool fully applies.

A.shortDesc: Starting Z Height. (Use Z to set the Ending Z Height.)

I.shortDesc: Starting Virtual Tool. The Gradient begins with this tool-mix. Below the Starting Z Height the Starting Virtual Tool fully applies.

J.shortDesc: Ending Virtual Tool. The Gradient transitions to this tool-mix as Z approaches the Ending Z Height. Above the Ending Z Height the Ending Virtual Tool fully applies.

S.shortDesc: Enable / disable the gradient in manual mode. When using the tool index alias, tool-change commands determine whether or not the gradient is enabled.

T.shortDesc: A tool index to reassign to the gradient. If no index is given, cancel the tool assignment.

Z.shortDesc: Ending Z Height. (Use A to set the Starting Z Height.)

M190.desc: This command optionally sets a new target temperature for the heated bed and waits for the target temperature to be reached before proceeding. If the temperature is set with S then it waits only when heating.

R.shortDesc: Target temperature (wait for cooling or heating).

S.shortDesc: Target temperature (wait only when heating).

M191.desc: This command optionally sets a new target chamber temperature and waits for the target temperature to be reached before proceeding. If the temperature is set with S then it waits only when heating.

R.shortDesc: Target temperature (wait for cooling or heating).

S.shortDesc: Target temperature (wait only when heating).

M192.desc: Use this command to dwell until the probe reaches a given target temperature.

R.shortDesc: Temperature to wait for, whether heating or cooling.

S.shortDesc: A minimum temperature to wait for. No wait if already higher.

M193.desc: M193 optionally sets the cooler target temperature and dwells until the cooler temperature is equal to or below the target. Any value greater than the COOLER_MAXTEMP (set in Configuratin_adv.h) will be set to the COOLER_MAXTEMP value. Use M143 if you want to set the target temperature without waiting or to turn the cooler off.

S.shortDesc: Target laser coolant temperature.

M200.desc: Set the filament’s current diameter and enable volumetric extrusion.

L.shortDesc: Set volumetric extruder limit (in mm3/sec). L0 disables the limit. (Requires VOLUMETRIC_EXTRUDER_LIMIT.)

S.shortDesc: 0 to disable volumetric extrusion mode, otherwise volumetric is enabled.

T.shortDesc: Extruder index. If omitted, the currently active extruder will be used.

M201.desc: Set the max acceleration for one or more axes (in current units-per-second squared). With XY_FREQUENCY_LIMIT you can also set the XY frequency limits.

E.shortDesc: E axis max acceleration

F.shortDesc: Planner frequency limit (Requires XY_FREQUENCY_LIMIT)

S.shortDesc: Planner XY frequency minimum speed percentage (Requires XY_FREQUENCY_LIMIT)

T.shortDesc: Target extruder (Requires DISTINCT_E_FACTORS)

X.shortDesc: X axis max acceleration

Y.shortDesc: Y axis max acceleration

Z.shortDesc: Z axis max acceleration

M203.desc: Set the max feedrate for one or more axes (in current units-per-second).

E.shortDesc: E axis max feedrate

T.shortDesc: Target extruder (Requires DISTINCT_E_FACTORS)

X.shortDesc: X axis max feedrate

Y.shortDesc: Y axis max feedrate

Z.shortDesc: Z axis max feedrate

M204.desc: Set the preferred starting acceleration (in units/s/s) for moves of different types. Send M204 with no parameters to get current settings.

P.shortDesc: Printing acceleration. Used for moves that include extrusion (i.e., which employ the current tool).

R.shortDesc: Retract acceleration. Used for extruder retraction moves.

S.shortDesc: Legacy parameter for move acceleration. Set both printing and travel acceleration.

T.shortDesc: Travel acceleration. Used for moves that include no extrusion.

M205.desc: Set various motion settings. See parameters for details.

B.shortDesc: Minimum segment time (µs)

E.shortDesc: E max jerk (units/s)

S.shortDesc: Minimum feedrate for print moves (units/s)

T.shortDesc: Minimum feedrate for travel moves (units/s)

X.shortDesc: X max jerk (units/s)

Y.shortDesc: Y max jerk (units/s)

Z.shortDesc: Z max jerk (units/s)

M206.desc: Use M206 to apply a persistent offset to the native home position and coordinate space. This effectively shifts the coordinate space in the negative direction. See examples below.

T.shortDesc: SCARA Theta offset (Requires MORGAN_SCARA)

X.shortDesc: X home offset

Y.shortDesc: Y home offset

Z.shortDesc: Z home offset

M207.desc: Set lengths, feedrate, and Z lift for firmware-based retraction. See parameters below.

F.shortDesc: Retract feedrate (units/min)

S.shortDesc: Retract length

Z.shortDesc: Z lift on retraction

M208.desc: Set the added lengths and feedrates for firmware-based retract recovery. The lengths set by M208 are applied in addition to the lengths set by M207 when un-retracting (aka “recovering”) the filament. The new values will apply to all subsequent G11 commands.

F.shortDesc: Recover feedrate (units/min)

S.shortDesc: Additional recover length. Can be negative to reduce recover length.

W.shortDesc: Additional recover swap length. Can be negative to reduce the length.

M209.desc: Enable or disable automatic retraction. This option is meant to help slicers that don’t support G10/G11. But it can be used to override retraction in any G-code.

S.shortDesc: Set Auto-Retract on/off

M211.desc: Optionally enable/disable software endstops, then report the current state.

S.shortDesc: Software endstops state (S1=enable S0=disable)

M217.desc: When changing tools on some setups, one filament may be retracted before the other is primed. This command sets the length and feedrates used for the filament swap retract and prime.

B.shortDesc: Extra resume

E.shortDesc: Extra Prime Length

F.shortDesc: Fan speed (0-255)

Q.shortDesc: Prime active tool using TOOLCHANGE_FILAMENT_SWAP settings

S.shortDesc: Swap length

U.shortDesc: Unretract feedrate

V.shortDesc: Enable First Prime on uninitialized Nozzles. Requires TOOLCHANGE_FS_PRIME_FIRST_USED.

W.shortDesc: Enable Park Feature. Requires TOOLCHANGE_PARK - was SINGLENOZZLE_SWAP_PARK.

X.shortDesc: Park X position. Requires TOOLCHANGE_PARK - was SINGLENOZZLE_SWAP_PARK.

Y.shortDesc: Park Y position. Requires TOOLCHANGE_PARK - was SINGLENOZZLE_SWAP_PARK.

Z.shortDesc: Z Raise.

M218.desc: To keep nozzles aligned to the work area between tool-changes, the firmware needs to know how they relate to each other.

T.shortDesc: Hotend index. Active extruder by default.

X.shortDesc: Hotend X offset

Y.shortDesc: Hotend Y offset

Z.shortDesc: Hotend Z offset. Requires DUAL_X_CARRIAGE or SWITCHING_NOZZLE.

M220.desc: Set speed percentage factor, aka “Feed Rate” which applies to all G-code-based moves in all (X, Y, Z, and E) axes. Report the current speed percentage factor if no parameter is specified.

B.shortDesc: Back up current factor

S.shortDesc: Feedrate percentage

M221.desc: Set the flow percentage, which applies to all E moves added to the planner.

S.shortDesc: Feedrate percentage

T.shortDesc: Target extruder (requires multi-extruder). Default is the active extruder.

M226.desc: Wait for a pin to have a certain value or state.

S.shortDesc: State 0 or 1. Default -1 for inverted.

M240.desc: Trigger a camera shutter using a digital pin or by bumping a physical switch.

A.shortDesc: Offset to the X return position. (Requires PHOTO_POSITION)

B.shortDesc: Offset to the Y return position. (Requires PHOTO_POSITION)

D.shortDesc: Duration to hold down the shutter switch. (Requires PHOTO_SWITCH_POSITION and PHOTO_SWITCH_MS)

F.shortDesc: Feedrate for the main photo moves. If omitted, the homing feedrate will be used. (Requires PHOTO_POSITION)

I.shortDesc: Shutter switch X position. If omitted, the photo move X position applies. (Requires PHOTO_SWITCH_POSITION)

J.shortDesc: Shutter switch Y position. If omitted, the photo move Y position applies. (Requires PHOTO_SWITCH_POSITION)

P.shortDesc: Delay after pressing the shutter switch. (Requires PHOTO_SWITCH_POSITION and PHOTO_SWITCH_MS)

S.shortDesc: Retract/recover feedrate. (Requires PHOTO_POSITION)

X.shortDesc: Main photo move X position. (Requires PHOTO_POSITION)

Y.shortDesc: Main photo move Y position. (Requires PHOTO_POSITION)

Z.shortDesc: Main photo move Z raise. (Requires PHOTO_POSITION)

M250.desc: Set and/or get the LCD contrast. The value is constrained based on the LCD.

M255.desc: Set and/or get the LCD sleep / backlight timeout, in minutes. The display will go blank to save energy after your specified period has elapsed with no activity. The screen will wake up if it needs to display an important message.

S.shortDesc: Timeout delay in minutes.

M256.desc: Set and/or get the LCD brightness. The value is constrained based on the LCD, but typically a value of 0 is the dimmest and 255 is the brightest.

B.shortDesc: Brightness value (0 - 255)

M260.desc: Utility to send data over the I2C bus.

A.shortDesc: The bus address to send to

B.shortDesc: The byte to add to the buffer

R.shortDesc: Reset and rewind the I2C buffer

S.shortDesc: Send flag. Flush the buffer to the bus.

M261.desc: Request bytes from the I2C bus and echo them to the host. To find out how to do more useful things with I2C see the I2C master / slave article.

A.shortDesc: The bus address to request bytes from

B.shortDesc: The number of bytes to request

S.shortDesc: Output style. Default is 0 (raw echo) if nothing else is given.

M280.desc: Set or get the position of a servo.

P.shortDesc: Servo index to set or get

S.shortDesc: Servo position to set. Omit to read the current position.

M281.desc: Set or get the position of a servo. Without L or U the current values will be reported.

U.shortDesc: Stow angle in degrees.

M282.desc: Detach a servo, which turns off its power. The servo will be attached (powered up) before its next move.

P.shortDesc: Index of the servo to detach.

M290.desc: Apply babysteps to one or more axes using current units. Offsets applied with M290 aren’t added to the current coordinates, but are intended for making small adjustments, especially in the Z axis, at the start of a print.

P.shortDesc: Use P0 to leave the Probe Z Offset unaffected. (Requires BABYSTEP_ZPROBE_OFFSET)

S.shortDesc: Alias for Z

X.shortDesc: A distance on the X axis

Y.shortDesc: A distance on the Y axis

Z.shortDesc: A distance on the Z axis

M300.desc: Add a tone to the tone queue.

S.shortDesc: Frequency (260Hz)

M301.desc: Set the values that control the PID loop for a hotend.

E.shortDesc: Extruder index to set. Default 0.

F.shortDesc: F term (requires PID_FAN_SCALING)

M302.desc: Set the minimum extrusion temperature, potentially allowing E movement at temperatures below the melting point of the material.

P.shortDesc: Flag to allow extrusion at any temperature

S.shortDesc: Minimum temperature for safe extrusion

M303.desc: This command initiates a process of heating and cooling to determine the proper PID values for the specified hotend or the heated bed.

C.shortDesc: Cycles. At least 3 cycles are required. Default 5.

E.shortDesc: Hotend index (-1 for heated bed). Default 0.

S.shortDesc: Target temperature

U.shortDesc: Use PID result. (Otherwise just print it out.)

M304.desc: Set the values that control the PID loop for the heated bed.

B.shortDesc: Thermistor “beta” value

T.shortDesc: Resistance at 25C

E.shortDesc: Extruder index. If omitted, the command applies to the active extruder.

F.shortDesc: Ambient heat transfer coefficient (fan on full).

R.shortDesc: Sensor responsiveness (= transfer coefficient / heat capacity).

T.shortDesc: Autotune the selected extruder.

M350.desc: If your board has digital micro-stepping pins (X_MS1, Y_MS1, etc.), use this command to set the micro-steps.

B.shortDesc: Set micro-stepping for the 5th stepper driver.

E.shortDesc: Set micro-stepping for the E0 stepper driver.

S.shortDesc: Set micro-stepping for all 5 stepper drivers.

X.shortDesc: Set micro-stepping for the X stepper driver.

Y.shortDesc: Set micro-stepping for the Y stepper driver.

Z.shortDesc: Set micro-stepping for the Z stepper driver.

M351.desc: If your board has digital micro-stepping pins (X_MS1, Y_MS1, etc.), use this command to set the micro-steps.

B.shortDesc: Set the MS1/2 pin for the 5th stepper driver.

E.shortDesc: Set the MS1/2 pin for the E stepper driver.

S.shortDesc: Select the pin to set for all specified axes.

X.shortDesc: Set the MS1/2 pin for the X stepper driver.

Y.shortDesc: Set the MS1/2 pin for the Y stepper driver.

Z.shortDesc: Set the MS1/2 pin for the Z stepper driver.

M355.desc: Set the case light power state and/or brightness.

P.shortDesc: Set the brightness factor from 0 to 255.

S.shortDesc: Turn the case light on or off.

M360.desc: Move the nozzle to SCARA calibration position Theta 0 (A0 B120) for calibration of “zero degrees.”

M361.desc: Move the nozzle to SCARA Theta-B calibration position Theta 90 (A90 B130) for calibration of “90 degrees steps-per-degree.”

M362.desc: Move the nozzle to SCARA Psi-A calibration position Psi 0 (A60 B180) for calibration of “zero degrees.”

M363.desc: Move the nozzle to SCARA Psi-B calibration position Psi 90 (A50 B90) for calibration of “90 degrees steps-per-degree.”

M364.desc: Move the nozzle to SCARA Psi-C calibration position Theta-Psi 90 (A45 B135) for calibration of “90 degrees to Theta.”

M380.desc: Activate the solenoid on the active extruder.

S.shortDesc: Solenoid index (Requires MANUAL_SOLENOID_CONTROL)

M381.desc: Deactivate all solenoids on all extruders.

S.shortDesc: Solenoid index (Requires MANUAL_SOLENOID_CONTROL)

M400.desc: This command causes G-code processing to pause and wait in a loop until all moves in the planner are completed.

M401.desc: Deploy the bed probe. The Z axis may raise up to make room for the probe to deploy.

H.shortDesc: Report the current BLTouch High Speed (HS) Mode state and exit.

S.shortDesc: Set the BLTouch High Speed (HS) Mode state and exit without deploy.

M402.desc: Stow the bed probe. The Z axis may raise up to make room for the probe to stow.

M403.desc: Set the filament type for a Průša MMU2 (or compatible) material slot.

E.shortDesc: The MMU2 slot [0..4] to set the material type for

F.shortDesc: The filament type.

M404.desc: Report or set the nominal filament width, such as 1.75 or 3.00.

M405.desc: Turn on the filament width sensor and start using it to do flow control. Initially, the filament between the sensor and the hot-end will be treated as the nominal width.

D.shortDesc: Distance from measurement point to hot end. If not given, the previous value will be used. The default startup value is set by MEASUREMENT_DELAY_CM.

M406.desc: Turn off the filament width sensor and stop using it to do flow control.

M407.desc: Report the current measured filament width to the host.

M410.desc: Stop all steppers instantly. Since there will be no deceleration, steppers are expected to be out of position after this command.

M412.desc: Get or set filament runout status and distance. Omit all parameters to get a report of the current stats. Enable or disable filament runout detection with S and set distance with D. When filament sensors are enabled, Marlin will respond to a filament runout by running the configured G-code (usually M600 Filament Change). When filament runout detection is disabled, Marlin will take no action for filament runout.

H.shortDesc: Flag to enable or disable host handling of a filament runout.

R.shortDesc: Flag to reset the filament runout sensor. Not needed with S.

S.shortDesc: Flag to enable or disable Filament Runout Detection. If omitted, the current enabled state will be reported.

M413.desc: M413 is used to turn the Power-loss Recovery feature on and off. When Power-loss Recovery is enabled and Marlin is running a print job from the SD Card or Flash Drive, it periodically saves the print job state to the SD Card / Flash Drive. If the machine crashes or a power outage occurs, Marlin presents the option to resume the interrupted print job.

S.shortDesc: Flag to enable or disable Power-loss Recovery. If omitted, the current enabled state will be reported.

M420.desc: Get and/or set bed leveling state. For mesh-based leveling systems use Z parameter to set the Z Fade Height.

C.shortDesc: Center the mesh on the mean of the lowest and highest points

L.shortDesc: Load mesh from EEPROM index (Requires AUTO_BED_LEVELING_UBL and EEPROM_SETTINGS)

S.shortDesc: Set enabled or disabled. A valid mesh is required to enable bed leveling. If the mesh is invalid / incomplete leveling will not be enabled.

T.shortDesc: Format to print the mesh data

V.shortDesc: Verbose: Print the stored mesh / matrix data

Z.shortDesc: Set Z fade height (Requires ENABLE_LEVELING_FADE_HEIGHT)

M421.desc: This command is used to set a single Z value for a mesh point in the stored bed leveling data.

C.shortDesc: Set the mesh point closest to the current nozzle position (AUTO_BED_LEVELING_UBL only)

I.shortDesc: X index into the mesh array

J.shortDesc: Y index into the mesh array

N.shortDesc: Set the mesh point to undefined (AUTO_BED_LEVELING_UBL only)

Q.shortDesc: A value to add to the existing Z value

X.shortDesc: X position (which should be very close to a grid line) (MESH_BED_LEVELING only)

Y.shortDesc: Y position (which should be very close to a grid line) (MESH_BED_LEVELING only)

Z.shortDesc: The new Z value to set

M422.desc: Set an XY probe or known position for a given Z Stepper. Either the S or W parameter must be given, along with X and Y positions. The W parameter exists only when Z_STEPPER_ALIGN_STEPPER_XY is defined, providing known stepper positions.

R.shortDesc: Reset alignment and known points to the defaults. This will also be done by M502.

S.shortDesc: One-based index of a Z-Stepper whose probing-point will be set.

W.shortDesc: One-based index of a Z-Stepper whose known position will be set.

X.shortDesc: X position

Y.shortDesc: Y position

M423.desc: Use M423 to reset, modify, or report X-Twist Compensation data.

A.shortDesc: Set the X-Axis Twist Compensation starting X position.

I.shortDesc: Set the X-Axis Twist Compensation X-spacing.

R.shortDesc: Reset the Twist Compensation array to the configured default values.

X.shortDesc: Zero-based index into the Twist Compensation array. Requires a Z value.

Z.shortDesc: A Z-offset value to set in the Twist Compensation array. Requires an X index.

M425.desc: Backlash compensation will add extra steps to one or more segments whenever a motor reverses direction.

F.shortDesc: Enable or disables backlash correction, or sets an intermediate fade-out (0.0 = none; 1.0 = 100%)

S.shortDesc: Distance over which backlash correction is spread

X.shortDesc: Set the backlash distance on X (mm; 0 to disable)

Y.shortDesc: Set the backlash distance on Y (mm; 0 to disable)

Z.shortDesc: When MEASURE_BACKLASH_WHEN_PROBING is enabled, loads the measured backlash into the backlash distance parameter

M428.desc: Use M428 to set a persistent offset to the native home position and coordinate space by assigning the current position as the native home position. See the example below.

M430.desc: Enable/disable power monitor on LCD display. Report current/amps (A), voltage (V) and watts (W) if no parameters.

M486.desc: Use M486 to identify and cancel objects during a multi-object print job.

P.shortDesc: Cancel the object with the given index.

S.shortDesc: Set the index of the current object. If the object with the given index has been canceled, this will cause the firmware to skip to the next object. The value -1 is used to indicate something that isn’t an object and shouldn’t be skipped.

T.shortDesc: Reset the state and set the number of objects.

U.shortDesc: Un-cancel the object with the given index. This command will be ignored if the object has already been skipped.

M493.desc: The Fixed-Time Motion Planner is an additional motion planning system provided by Ulendo.io as an add-on to Marlin Firmware. It currently supports Cartesian and Core kinematics. It may be extended for Delta in the future. The FT_MOTION feature can be enabled at the same time as Marlin’s integrated ZV Input Shaper, but these features do not share settings. It has its own implementation of Linear Advance (aka Pressure Advance) with its own gain parameter separate from M900.

A.shortDesc: Set the Base Frequency for Input Shaping on the X axis.

B.shortDesc: Set the Base Frequency for Input Shaping on the Y axis.

F.shortDesc: Set the Frequency Scaling factor for Input Shaping on the X axis.

H.shortDesc: Set the Frequency Scaling factor for Input Shaping on the Y axis.

K.shortDesc: Set the gain for Linear Advance.

S.shortDesc: Set the current motion mode and/or Input Shaper.

M500.desc: Save all configurable settings to EEPROM.

M501.desc: Load all saved settings from EEPROM.

M502.desc: Reset all configurable settings to their factory defaults.

M503.desc: Print a concise report of all runtime-configurable settings (in SRAM) to the host console. This command reports the active settings which may or may not be the same as those stored in the EEPROM.

C.shortDesc: Save the embedded configuration ZIP file to the SD Card or Flash Drive.

S.shortDesc: Detailed output flag. (true if omitted.)

M504.desc: Validate the contents of the EEPROM.

M510.desc: Lock the machine. When the machine is locked a passcode is required to unlock it. Use M511 P with your passcode to unlock the machine.option.

M511.desc: Check the given passcode and unlock the machine if it is correct. Otherwise, delay for a period of time before allowing another attempt.

M512.desc: Check the passcode given with P and if it is correct clear the passcode. If a new passcode is given with S then set a new passcode.

P.shortDesc: Current passcode. This must be correct to clear or change the passcode.

S.shortDesc: If S is included the new passcode will be set to this value.

M524.desc: Abort an SD print in progress and turn off all heaters.

M540.desc: Set whether SD printing should abort in the event of any endstop being triggered. This provides a fast way to abort a print in the event of mechanical failure such as loose couplings, lost steps, diverted axes, binding, etc., which lead to axes being very far out of position.

S.shortDesc: Whether (1) or not (0) to abort SD printing on endstop hit.

M569.desc: Toggle between stealthChop and spreadCycle on supporting TMC drivers.

E.shortDesc: Stepping mode for the E0 stepper

I.shortDesc: Index for multiple steppers. Use I1 for X2, Y2, and/or Z2, and I2 for Z3.

T.shortDesc: Index (tool) number for the E axis. If not specified, the E0 extruder.

X.shortDesc: Stepping mode for the X stepper

Y.shortDesc: Stepping mode for the Y stepper

Z.shortDesc: Stepping mode for the Z stepper

M575.desc: Change the baud rate of one serial port or all serial ports. This command will interrupt serial communication to the host and may reset the firmware when the host reconnects at the new baud rate.

B.shortDesc: The baud rate to set. Permitted values are:

P.shortDesc: Serial Port index. Omit for all serial ports.

M593.desc: Set the Input Shaping damping factor and/or frequency (in Hertz) for axes that support it. Use M593 with no parameters to report the current settings.

D.shortDesc: Set the zeta/damping factor for the specified axes. If X and Y are omitted, both will be set.

F.shortDesc: Set the damping frequency for the specified axes. If X and Y are omitted, both will be set.

X.shortDesc: Flag to set the X axis value. If X and Y are omitted, both will be set.

Y.shortDesc: Flag to set the Y axis value. If X and Y are omitted, both will be set.

M600.desc: The M600 command initiates the filament change procedure. The basic procedure will move the print head away from the print, eject the filament, wait for new filament to be inserted and the user to confirm, load and prime the filament, and continue with the print. M600 may be initiated automatically if a filament runout sensor is installed.

B.shortDesc: Number of beeps to alert user of filament change (default FILAMENT_CHANGE_ALERT_BEEPS)

E.shortDesc: Retract before moving to change position (negative, default PAUSE_PARK_RETRACT_LENGTH)

T.shortDesc: Target extruder

U.shortDesc: Amount of retraction for unload (negative)

X.shortDesc: X position for filament change

Y.shortDesc: Y position for filament change

Z.shortDesc: Z relative lift for filament change position

M603.desc: The M603 command configures automatic filament change parameters.

T.shortDesc: Target extruder

U.shortDesc: Amount of retraction for unload (negative)

M605.desc: Set the behavior mode for multiple fixed nozzles such as a Dual Extruder or DUAL_X_CARRIAGE machine.

E.shortDesc: Last nozzle index to include in the duplication set. 0 disables duplication. (Requires MULTI_NOZZLE_DUPLICATION)

P.shortDesc: Bit-mask of nozzles to include in the duplication set. 0 disables duplication. Bit 1 is E0, Bit 2 is E1 … Bit n is E(n-1). (Requires MULTI_NOZZLE_DUPLICATION)

R.shortDesc: Temperature difference to apply to E1. (Requires DUAL_X_CARRIAGE)

S.shortDesc: Select the pin to set for all specified axes.

X.shortDesc: X distance between dual X carriages. (Requires DUAL_X_CARRIAGE)

B.shortDesc: Theta offset, alias for T

P.shortDesc: Theta-Psi offset, added to the shoulder (A/X) angle

S.shortDesc: Segments per second

T.shortDesc: Theta offset, added to the elbow (B/Y) angle

X.shortDesc: Theta-Psi offset, alias for P

Y.shortDesc: Theta offset, alias for T

M666.desc: Use the M666 command to adjust the offsets for dual (or multiple) endstops.

X.shortDesc: Offset for the X axis endstops

Y.shortDesc: Offset for the Y axis endstops

Z.shortDesc: Offset for the Z axis endstops

M672.desc: Set or reset Duet Smart Effector sensitivity.

S.shortDesc: Set sensitivity (0-255)

M701.desc: Load filament into the active extruder. By default this will use the configured ADVANCED_PAUSE_FEATURE settings.

L.shortDesc: Extrude distance for insertion (positive value) (manual reload)

T.shortDesc: Optional extruder index. Current extruder if omitted.

Z.shortDesc: Move the Z axis by this distance

M702.desc: Unload filament. By default this command will use the configured ADVANCED_PAUSE_FEATURE settings.

T.shortDesc: Optional extruder number. If omitted, current extruder (or ALL extruders with FILAMENT_UNLOAD_ALL_EXTRUDERS).

U.shortDesc: Retract distance for removal (manual reload)

Z.shortDesc: Move the Z axis by this distance

M710.desc: Set one or more Controller Fan options. Without any parameters report the current settings.

A.shortDesc: Set whether the fan speed is set automatically. When turned off the controller fan speed will remain where it is.

D.shortDesc: Set the extra duration to keep the fan speed high after motors are turned off.

I.shortDesc: Set the speed of the controller fan when motors are off.

R.shortDesc: Reset all settings to defaults. Other parameters can be included to override.

S.shortDesc: Set the speed of the controller fan when motors are active.

M808.desc: The Repeat Marker command is used to define regions of a G-code file that will be repeated during SD printing. A marker is first set with M808 L[count], and later in the file a plain M808 command is used count down and loop. (By default up to 10 start markers can be nested.)

L.shortDesc: Loop counter. Use L or L0 for an infinite loop.

M810.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M811.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M812.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M813.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M814.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M815.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M816.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M817.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M818.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M819.desc: Use the M810-M819 commands to set and execute 10 distinct G-code “macros.” Put anything after the command to define its macro. To run the macro just send M810-M819 by itself. Multiple commands in one macro are separated by the pipe character (‘|’).

s.shortDesc: Set Macro to the given commands, separated by the pipe character.

M851.desc: Set the XYZ distance from the nozzle to the probe trigger-point.

X.shortDesc: Z probe X offset

Y.shortDesc: Z probe Y offset

Z.shortDesc: Z probe Z offset

M852.desc: Bed Skew Compensation corrects for misalignment in the XY, XZ, and ZY axes through the use of correction factors.

I.shortDesc: Skew correction factor for XY axis.

J.shortDesc: Skew correction factor for XZ axis

K.shortDesc: Skew correction factor for YZ axis

S.shortDesc: Alias for I when only XY skew correction is enabled

M860.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M861.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M862.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M863.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M864.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M865.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M866.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M867.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M868.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M869.desc: I2C position encoders for closed loop control. Developed by Chris Barr at Aus3D. Wiki: https://wiki.aus3d.com.au/Magnetic_Encoder Github: https://github.com/Aus3D/MagneticEncoder

E.shortDesc: Report on E axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

O.shortDesc: Include homed zero-offset in returned position

S.shortDesc: Enable/disable error correction. 1 enables, 0 disables. If not supplied, toggle. (for M867 only)

T.shortDesc: New error correction threshold. (for M868 only)

U.shortDesc: Units in mm or raw step count. (for M860 only)

X.shortDesc: Report on X axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Y.shortDesc: Report on Y axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

Z.shortDesc: Report on Z axis encoder if present. (If A or I not specified)

M871.desc: Read/write probe temperature compensation values. Values for bed and/or probe can be calibrated using the G76 command.

B.shortDesc: Store the value V as the Z adjustment at index I for the Bed.

E.shortDesc: Store the value V as the Z adjustment at index I for the Extruder.

I.shortDesc: Index at which to store the given Z adjustment value.

P.shortDesc: Store the value V as the Z adjustment at index I for the Probe.

R.shortDesc: Reset all Z adjustment values to factory defaults (zero).

M876.desc: Handle responses from the host, such as:

S.shortDesc: Response to prompt

M900.desc: This command sets and/or reports the Linear Advance K factors.

K.shortDesc: The K factor to set for the specified extruder. Unchanged if omitted. Set this value higher for more flexible filament or a longer filament path.

L.shortDesc: Set the second K factor for the specified extruder. Requires EXTRA_LIN_ADVANCE_K. Note that this factor may be inactive and won’t take effect until the next M900 S1.

S.shortDesc: Select slot and activate the last stored value. Requires EXTRA_LIN_ADVANCE_K.

T.shortDesc: Extruder to which K, L, and S will apply. Requires EXTRA_LIN_ADVANCE_K.

M906.desc: Set stepper motor currents in milliamps units.

E.shortDesc: Current for the E0 stepper

I.shortDesc: Index for multiple steppers. (i.e., I1 for X2, Y2, Z2; I2 for Z3; I3 for Z4).

T.shortDesc: Index (tool) number for the E axis. If not specified, the E0 extruder.

X.shortDesc: Current for the X stepper

Y.shortDesc: Current for the Y stepper

Z.shortDesc: Current for the Z stepper

M907.desc: Set digital trimpot motor current using axis codes X, Y, Z, E, plus B and S. The unit used for current depends on the type of stepper driver.

B.shortDesc: Current for the E1 stepper (Requires DIGIPOTSS_PIN or DIGIPOT_I2C)

C.shortDesc: Current for the E2 stepper (Requires DIGIPOT_I2C)

D.shortDesc: Current for the E3 stepper (Requires DIGIPOT_I2C)

E.shortDesc: Current for the E0 stepper

S.shortDesc: Set this current on all steppers (Requires DIGIPOTSS_PIN or DAC_STEPPER_CURRENT)

X.shortDesc: Current for the X stepper (and the Y stepper with MOTOR_CURRENT_PWM_XY)

Y.shortDesc: Current for the Y stepper (Use X with MOTOR_CURRENT_PWM_XY)

Z.shortDesc: Current for the Z stepper

M908.desc: Set the digital trimpot current directly by address/channel/pin index. DAC_STEPPER_CURRENT pertains to the MCP4728.

S.shortDesc: Current value

M909.desc: Print the DAC stepper current values in the format “% (Amps)”.

M910.desc: Commit digipot/DAC value to external EEPROM via I2C.

M911.desc: Report the TMC stepper driver overtemperature pre-warn condition to the host.

M912.desc: Clear the stepper driver overtemperature pre-warn condition flag.

E.shortDesc: Clear all or one E stepper driver Over Temperature Pre-warn flag.

I.shortDesc: Stepper number to set. If omitted, all specified axes.

X.shortDesc: Clear X and/or X2 stepper driver Over Temperature Pre-warn flag.

Y.shortDesc: Clear Y and/or Y2 stepper driver Over Temperature Pre-warn flag.

Z.shortDesc: Clear Z and/or Z2 and/or Z3 stepper driver Over Temperature Pre-warn flag.

M913.desc: When HYBRID_THRESHOLD is enabled, the TMC driver is switched from the quieter StealthChop to spreadCycle when the feed rate for a given stepper motor is over its _HYBRID_THRESHOLD.

E.shortDesc: Set Hybrid Threshold for E to the given value.

I.shortDesc: Index for multiple steppers. (i.e., I1 for X2, Y2, Z2; I2 for Z3; I3 for Z4).

T.shortDesc: Index (tool) number for the E axis. If not specified, the E0 extruder.

X.shortDesc: Set Hybrid Threshold for X to the given value.

Y.shortDesc: Set Hybrid Threshold for Y to the given value.

Z.shortDesc: Set Hybrid Threshold for Z to the given value.

M914.desc: Some TMC stepper drivers can detect when they bump into something that causes them to stop moving. This feature is so sensitive that it can actually take the place of traditional endstops. Use this command to set the bump sensitivity for the X, Y, and Z stepper drivers.

I.shortDesc: Index for multiple steppers. (i.e., I1 for X2, Y2, Z2; I2 for Z3; I3 for Z4).

X.shortDesc: Sensitivity of the X stepper driver.

Y.shortDesc: Sensitivity of the Y stepper driver.

Z.shortDesc: Sensitivity of the Z stepper driver.

M915.desc: The command aims to align the ends of the X gantry (for a Průša i3-style printer). See the video demonstration above.

S.shortDesc: Current value to use for the raise move. (Default: CALIBRATION_CURRENT)

Z.shortDesc: Extra distance past Z_MAX_POS to move the Z axis. (Default: CALIBRATION_EXTRA_HEIGHT)

M916.desc: M916: increase KVAL_HOLD until thermal warning. This routine is also useful for determining the approximate KVAL_HOLD where the stepper stops losing steps. The sound will get noticeably quieter as it stops losing steps.

D.shortDesc: Time (in seconds) to run each setting of KVAL_HOLD/TVAL. (Default zero, to run each setting once.)

E.shortDesc: Monitor E with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

F.shortDesc: Feedrate for the moves. (Default max feedrate if unspecified.)

J.shortDesc: Select which driver(s) to monitor on multi-driver axis

K.shortDesc: Value for KVAL_HOLD (0 - 255) (ignored for L6474). If unspecified, report current value from driver.

T.shortDesc: Current (mA) setting for TVAL (0 - 4A in 31.25mA increments, rounds down) - L6474 only. If unspecified, report current value from driver.

X.shortDesc: Monitor X with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

Y.shortDesc: Monitor Y with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

Z.shortDesc: Monitor Z with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

M917.desc: The M917 command runs a test procedure to find the minimum stepper current thresholds.

E.shortDesc: Monitor E with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

F.shortDesc: Feedrate for the moves. If unspecified, uses the max feedrate.

I.shortDesc: Starting overcurrent threshold. Report current value from driver if not specified. If there are multiple drivers on the axis then all will be set the same.

J.shortDesc: Select which driver(s) to monitor on multi-driver axis.

K.shortDesc: Value for KVAL_HOLD (0 - 255) (ignored for L6474). Report current value from driver if not specified

T.shortDesc: Current (mA) setting for TVAL (0 - 4A in 31.25mA increments, rounds down) - L6474 only. Report current value from driver if not specified.

X.shortDesc: Monitor X with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

Y.shortDesc: Monitor Y with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

Z.shortDesc: Monitor Z with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

M918.desc: M918: Increase speed until error or max feedrate achieved.

E.shortDesc: Monitor E with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

I.shortDesc: Overcurrent threshold. Report current value from driver if not specified.

J.shortDesc: Select which driver(s) to monitor on a multi-driver axis.

K.shortDesc: Value for KVAL_HOLD (0 - 255) (ignored for L6474). Report current value from driver if not specified.

M.shortDesc: Value for microsteps (1 - 128). Report current value from driver if not specified.

T.shortDesc: Current (mA) setting for TVAL (0 - 4A in 31.25mA increments, rounds down) - L6474 only. Report current value from driver if not specified.

X.shortDesc: Monitor X with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

Y.shortDesc: Monitor Y with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

Z.shortDesc: Monitor Z with the given displacement (1 - 255mm) on either side of the current position.

M919.desc: Set / report the TMC Chopper Timing values for one or more stepper drivers.

A.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the A stepper. (Requires 4 or more axes.)

B.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the B stepper. (Requires 5 or more axes.)

C.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the C stepper. (Requires 6 or more axes.)

I.shortDesc: Index for multiple steppers. (i.e., I1 for X2, Y2, Z2; I2 for Z3; I3 for Z4). If omitted, all steppers for the selected axes.

O.shortDesc: Time-Off value (1..15). If omitted, use configured defaults for the axes.

P.shortDesc: Hysteresis End value (-3..12). If omitted, use configured defaults for the axes.

S.shortDesc: Hysteresis Start value (1..8). If omitted, use configured defaults for the axes.

T.shortDesc: Index (tool) number for the E axis. If omitted, all extruders.

U.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the U stepper. (Requires 7 or more axes.)

V.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the V stepper. (Requires 8 or more axes.)

W.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the W stepper. (Requires 9 axes.)

X.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the X stepper(s).

Y.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the Y stepper(s). (Requires 2 or more axes.)

Z.shortDesc: Apply the given chopper timing to the Z stepper(s). (Requires 3 or more axes.)

M928.desc: Use this command to start logging all console and host input to an SD file while still operating the machine.

M951.desc: Set MAGNETIC_PARKING_EXTRUDER settings. With no parameters, report the current settings.

M993.desc: M993: backup SPI Flash to SD M994: load a backup from SD to SPI Flash

M994.desc: M993: backup SPI Flash to SD M994: load a backup from SD to SPI Flash

M995.desc: Trigger touch screen calibration menu on display

M997.desc: Can be used to trigger a firmware update from the SD card after the firmware binary has been uploaded remotely.

M999.desc: If a STOP occurs you can use M999 to restart the “stopped” machine after resolving the issue.

S.shortDesc: Resume without flushing the command buffer. The default behavior is to flush the serial buffer and request a resend to the host starting on the last N line received.

M7219.desc: Set the state of one or more Max7219 matrix displays or 7-segment digital displays.

C.shortDesc: Set the column specified by C to bit pattern V.

D.shortDesc: Directly set a Max7219 native row (on the unit specified by U) to the 8-bit pattern V.

F.shortDesc: Fill the matrix by turning on all LEDs.

P.shortDesc: Print the LED array state for debugging.

R.shortDesc: Set the row specified by R to bit pattern V.

U.shortDesc: Used with D to specify which matrix unit to set.

V.shortDesc: Value to apply when using the C, R, or X/Y parameters.

X.shortDesc: Set a matrix LED at the given X position to the V value. If no V is given, toggle the LED state.

Y.shortDesc: Set a matrix LED at the given Y position to the V value. If no V is given, toggle the LED state.

title: M-code Marlin Reference
description: function toUpperCase() { [native code] }-code reference for Marlin firmware 3d Printers",
